text: The Bohart House, at 510 N. Church in Bozeman, Montana, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It is a brick house, probably built by Freeman Bohart in 1889. With It was deemed significant as "one of the last houses in Bozeman built during the building boom which was triggered in the early 1880s by the arrival of the Northern Pacific Railroad. This house represents the northern limit of the city's residential expansion during that active period." Only cultivated fields lay beyond the site, according to an 1890 Sanborn map. It is a one-story house with a gable roof and a hipped roof porch. ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Gallatin County, Montana Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1889
title: Bohart House
